https://www.justonecookbook.com/kimchi-c.title: Kimchi Jjigae
instructions: Prepare the anchovy stock by soaking the dried anchovies in water for at least 30 minutes.
Cut the tofu into slices and chop the green onions, separating the white and green parts.
In a pot, heat the toasted sesame oil and stir fry the pork belly until it's no longer pink.
Add kimchi and seasonings to the pot, cooking for about 15 minutes.
Add the tofu and simmer for an additional 5 minutes before serving.

https://www.justonecookbook.com/oyakodon.title: Oyakodon
instructions: Prepare all ingredients: slice the onion, chop mitsuba or green onions, and cut the chicken into pieces.
Combine dashi, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar in a bowl.
In a pan, cook the onion with the seasoning mixture until tender.
Add chicken to the onion and cook until no longer pink.
Drizzle in the eggs two-thirds at a time, allowing them to cook gently, and garnish with mitsuba or green onions.
Serve over steamed rice, pouring the sauce on top.

https://recipe.edenheim.se/auth/confirm?.title: 404 Error: Page Not Found!
https://recipe.edenheim.se/auth/confirm?.originalTitle: 404 Cette page n'a pas pu être trouvée!

https://www.reddit.com/r/Staiy/comments/.title: Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Add the egg and mix until well combined.
Sift the flour and baking powder together, then gradually add it to the butter mixture, stirring until a dough forms.
Shape the dough into small balls and place them on a lined baking tray.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly golden brown.
Allow to cool on the tray for a few minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.

https://thefoodietakesflight.com/dumplin.title: Dumpling Dipping Sauce
instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl.
Adjust the taste according to preference.
Can be made in advance and stored in the refrigerator until ready to use.

https://www.arla.se/recept/refried-beans.title: Refried Beans
instructions: Peel and slice the shallots and garlic. Slice the jalapeño.
Drain and rinse the black beans.
Heat the butter & rapeseed oil in a pot. Sauté the shallots and jalapeño for 2-3 minutes.
Add the black beans and spices, and sauté for another 1-2 minutes.
Add water and the crumbled stock cube. Let the liquid reduce.
Mash the beans with a potato masher. Add lime zest, lime juice, and butter. Season with salt.
Top the refried beans with chopped coriander. Done!

https://www.modernistrecipesdb.com/recip.title: Apple Sauce
instructions: Peel and core the apples, then chop them into small pieces.
Place the apples in a microwave-safe bowl and add sugar and cinnamon.
Cover the bowl and microwave on high for 5 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Once done, mash the apples with a fork or blend until smooth.

https://www.arla.se/recept/laxsida-i-ugn.title: Laxsida i ugn
instructions: Preheat the oven to 150°C or 125°C for fan mode.
Remove any bones from the salmon and place it in an oven dish with the skin side down.
Brush the salmon with butter & rapeseed oil. Sprinkle with salt, black pepper, and finely grated lemon zest.
Bake in the oven until the internal temperature reaches 52-56°C, which takes about 25 minutes depending on your oven and the thickness of the salmon.
Meanwhile, boil the potatoes in lightly salted water and mix the cold sauce, refrigerating until serving.
Combine spinach with halved tomatoes and cucumber pieces, add olive oil and salt. Cut the lemon into wedges.
Serve the baked salmon side with potatoes, cold sauce, lemon wedges, and salad.

https://www.justonecookbook.com/stir-fry.title: Yasai Itame
instructions: Gather all ingredients.
Cut pork into smaller, bite-sized pieces and marinate with soy sauce and sake.
Prepare vegetables: remove strings from snow peas, cut onion into thin slices, cut cabbage into 2.5 cm pieces, and cut carrot into matchsticks.
Crush garlic and mince ginger.
Heat a frying pan on medium-high heat and add oil. Add garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add pork to the pan, stir-frying until about 80% cooked.
Add onion and stir-fry until almost tender, then add carrot and continue cooking.
Once the carrot starts to soften, add cabbage and snow peas, cooking until tender.
Add bean sprouts and toss. Mix in oyster sauce and soy sauce, adjusting flavor with salt and pepper.
Drizzle with toasted sesame oil, toss, and serve immediately.

https://recipe.edenheim.se/auth/confirm?.title: Crispy Tofu Stir-Fry
instructions: Press the tofu to remove excess moisture, then cut into cubes.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat and add minced garlic.
Add tofu cubes to the pan and cook until crispy, about 10 minutes.
Add the broccoli, carrot, and bell pepper to the pan, stirring well.
Pour soy sauce over the stir-fry and cook for an additional 5 minutes, until vegetables are tender-crisp.

http://localhost:3000/.title: Classic Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk and egg.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined; do not overmix.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and melt a little butter.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.

https://www.justonecookbook.com/udon-noo.title: Udon Noodle Soup
instructions: Prepare the homemade broth by combining dashi, mirin, sugar, soy sauce, and kosher salt in a medium saucepan and simmering gently, then remove from heat and cover.
Cook the udon noodles in a large pot of boiling water according to package instructions, then drain.
Divide the udon noodles into bowls, pour the hot broth over the noodles, and top with sliced green onions and shichimi togarashi.

https://www.justonecookbook.com/okonomiy.title: Okonomiyaki
instructions: In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, sugar, and baking powder.
Grate nagaimo and add to the bowl with dashi. Mix until combined and set aside.
Prepare the cabbage by cutting it into strips and draining excess moisture.
In a separate bowl, mix the rested batter with eggs, tenkasu, and pickled ginger.
Add the minced cabbage to the batter and mix well.
Heat oil in a frying pan or griddle and pour in the batter to form pancakes.
Place pork belly slices on top and cook covered until browned, then flip and cook until done.
Serve with okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, katsuobushi, aonori, and green onions.

https://www.arla.se/recept/lasagne.title: Lasagne
instructions: Preheat the oven to 225°C or 200°C for fan oven.
Peel and chop the onion and garlic. Sauté them in butter in a frying pan until soft.
Add the ground beef and cook while stirring until it crumbles.
Add crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, pepper, and the bouillon cube. Let the sauce simmer for about 5 minutes.
Whisk the flour into half of the milk in a saucepan.
Pour in the rest of the milk and bring to a boil while whisking. Let the sauce simmer for about 3 minutes.
Stir in 250g of the cheese and season with salt.
Layer the meat sauce, cheese sauce, and lasagne sheets in a greased ovenproof dish. Finish with sauce and sprinkle the remaining cheese on top.
Bake in the lower part of the oven for about 30 minutes. Done!
Tip: Try using fresh lasagne sheets. Reduce the baking time to 20 minutes.

https://www.arla.se/recept/semlor.title: Semlor (Swedish Cream Buns)
instructions: Warm the milk to a maximum of 37°C.
Crumble the yeast into a bowl, pour the milk over and stir until the yeast has dissolved. Add 240 g of the wheat flour. Mix and let rest for about 15 minutes.

Add 180 g wheat flour, egg, salt, ground cardamom and sugar. Work the butter in batches into the dough. Let the dough run for 7-10 minutes in a food processor to a smooth dough that releases around the edges of the bowl. Let rise for about 30 minutes under a baking sheet.
Divide the dough into 12 pieces and shape into smooth buns. Let rise on a baking sheet with baking paper for 1½-2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 210°C or 190°C hot air. Brush the buns with beaten egg and bake in the middle of the oven for 8-10 minutes. Let cool.
Cut off a lid on each bun. Scoop out a little of the inside of the buns and mix it with milk, grated almond paste and almond. Fill the buns with the mixture.
Whip the cream and put a dollop on each bun. Put the lids back on and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Done!

https://www.gutekueche.at/wiener-kaisers.title: Viennese Kaiserschmarrn
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, salt, egg yolks, and milk until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold into the batter.
Melt butter in a large, flat pan (22-24 cm diameter) over medium heat. Pour batter into the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Transfer the pan to a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 10-12 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
Remove from oven and tear the pancake into irregular pieces using two spoons.
Add raisins, stir well, and return the pan to the oven for about 1 minute.
Serve on plates, sprinkle with powdered sugar, and serve with compote or applesauce.

https://www.arla.se/recept/salsicciapast.title: Salsiccia Pasta
instructions: Peel and thinly slice the onion and carrot. Clean and slice the fennel. Finely chop the garlic. Halve the tomatoes.
Heat the butter in a frying pan. Fry the onion, carrot, fennel, garlic and tomatoes for about 5 minutes.
Make a cut in the sausage and remove the filling. Place in the frying pan and break up with a wooden spoon. Fry for 4-5 minutes.
Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the package.
Stir in tomato purée, chili flakes, wine and cream in the frying pan with the salsiccia. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Season with sugar and salt. Mix the drained pasta into the sauce.
Top the salsicciapasta with grated Parmesan cheese and coarsely chopped parsley. Done!

https://www.arla.se/recept/tacopaj.title: Taco Pie
instructions: Chop together butter, flour, and paprika powder into a crumbly mass, by hand or in a food processor. Add water and quickly work together into a smooth dough.
Press the dough into a pie tin or ovenproof dish, about 30 cm in diameter. Prick the dough with a fork and place the tin in the fridge for about 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 225°C or 200°C convection. Pre-bake the pie shell in the middle of the oven for about 12 minutes.
Brown the ground beef in butter. Add taco seasoning and water, let it cook for about 5 minutes.
Mix the flavored crème fraiche with the plain crème fraiche in a bowl. Halve the tomatoes and drain the chili pieces.
Fill the pie shell with the ground beef and spread the crème fraiche mixture on top. Cover with tomato halves and chili, sprinkle over cheese, and finally dust with paprika powder.
Bake the pie in the middle of the oven for about 25 minutes, until the cheese has a nice color. Serve with sour cream and taco chips.

https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/top.title: Topfenstrudel (Quark Strudel)
instructions: Melt the butter for the dough in a saucepan. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and powdered sugar. Add the melted butter and lukewarm water. Knead with the dough hook of a hand mixer for about 5 minutes until a smooth dough forms.
Grease a piece of plastic wrap with some oil and wrap the dough in it. Let it rest at room temperature for about 1 hour.

For the filling, melt the butter. Separate the eggs. Mix the quark with vanilla sugar, starch, and egg yolks. Stir in 50g of the melted butter. Beat the egg whites with sugar and salt until stiff and fold into the quark mixture. Stir in raisins as desired.

After the resting time, remove the dough from the wrap and roll it out on a floured surface into a slightly rectangular shape. Turn it over and flour lightly if necessary; the dough should no longer be sticky. Sprinkle a clean kitchen towel with some flour and place the dough on it.

Roll out the dough on the towel as thinly as possible. Slide your hands under the dough and carefully pull it into a rectangle (approx. 70 x 40 cm) until it is so thin that you can see the kitchen towel through it. Brush the edges of the dough thinly with some of the remaining melted butter.
Preheat the oven to 200°C top/bottom heat (convection: 180°C). Line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Spread the quark mixture as a strand on the short side of the dough. Fold in the edges on the left and right and roll up the strudel from the short side. Place it on the prepared baking sheet with the seam facing down. Brush with the remaining melted butter and bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar as desired.
